",z); return 0;} å®žéªŒ3æ­¤å¤„è¡¥å……äº†ä¸€ä¸ªå†’æ³¡ç®—æ³•ï¼Œæœ‰å…´è¶£å¯ä»¥ç‚¹è¿›æ¥ åŸºç¡€ç»ƒä¹ 2.2ï¼ˆè¡¥å……ï¼‰123456789101112131415161718192021222324252627//è¿™æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªå¾ˆç®€å•çš„å†’æ³¡ç®—æ³•ï¼Œåˆ©ç”¨å¾ªçŽ¯è§£å†³é—®é¢˜å­—ç¬¦ä¸²è¾“å‡ºæœ€å°asciiç å¯¹åº”çš„å­—ç¬¦#include <stdio.h>#include <string.h>int main(){ int a,temp; char c[50]; printf("è¯·è¾“å…¥ä¸€ä¸²å­—ç¬¦/n"); gets(c); a=strlen(c); printf("é•¿åº¦æ˜¯ï¼š%d/n",a); for(int i=0;i<a;i++) { for(int j=i+1;j<a;j++) //j<a å¦‚æžœç­‰äºŽaçš„è¯ æ•°ç»„å°±è¶…è¿‡äº†ï¼Œå› ä¸ºä»Ž0å¼€å§‹çš„ï¼Œæ¯”å¦‚a[4] å°±æ˜¯a[0],a[1],a[2],a[3] å››ä¸ªå¼•ç”¨,ä¸æ‡‚å°±åŽ»ç¿»ä¹¦ { if(c[i]>c[j]) { temp=c[j];//tempæä¾›ä¸€ä¸ªäº¤æ¢ä½œç”¨ c[j]=c[i]; c[i]=temp; } } } printf("æŽ’åºåŽï¼š%s/n",c); return 0;} è¿›é˜¶ç»ƒä¹ 3.51234567891011121314151617181920212223242526272829303132333435363738394041424344454647484950515253545556575859//è§£å†³æ­¤é—®é¢˜æœ‰æ›´ç®€å•çš„åŠžæ³•ï¼Œåˆ©ç”¨æ•°ç»„å’Œå¾ªçŽ¯ï¼Œè¯·è‡ªå·±æ€è€ƒ#include <stdio.h>int main(){ int day,month,year,sum = 0,leap; printf("please input year,month,day
"); scanf("%d%d%d",&year,&month,&day); switch(month) /*å…ˆè®¡ç®—æŸæœˆä»¥å‰æœˆä»½çš„æ€»å¤©æ•°*/ { case 1: sum=0; break; case 2: sum=31; break; case 3: sum=59; break; case 4: sum=90; break; case 5: sum=120; break; case 6: sum=151; break; case 7: sum=181; break; case 8: sum=212; break; case 9: sum=243; break; case 10: sum=273; break; case 11: sum=304; break; case 12: sum=334; break; default: printf("data error"); break; } sum=sum+day; /*å†åŠ ä¸ŠæŸå¤©çš„å¤©æ•°*/ if(year%400==0||(year%4==0&&year%100!=0)) /*åˆ¤æ–­æ˜¯ä¸æ˜¯é—°å¹´*/ leap=1; else leap=0; if(leap==1&&month>2) /*å¦‚æžœæ˜¯é—°å¹´ä¸”æœˆä»½å¤§äºŽ2,æ€»å¤©æ•°åº”è¯¥åŠ ä¸€å¤©*/ sum++; printf("It is the %dth day of %d year
",sum,year); return 0;} å®žéªŒ4æœ¬æ–‡ç« æ¶‰å«Œå‰§é€ï¼Œè¯·ç´§å¼ çš„å¾€ä¸‹çœ‹ è¯´åœ¨å‰é¢ï¼Œä»Šå¤©ä¸€ä½åœ¨è…¾è®¯æžå¼€å‘å·¥ä½œçš„å¤§ä½¬ç»™æˆ‘æŒ‡ç‚¹äº†ä¸€ä¸‹ï¼Œâ€æ‰¹è¯„â€œäº†æˆ‘printf(â€œ

",str); fclose(fp); return 0;} 2.5ä½¿ç”¨qsortï¼ˆï¼‰å‡½æ•°1234567891011121314151617181920212223242526272829#include <stdio.h>#include <stdlib.h>#include <time.h>int cmp1(const void * a,const void * b);int main(void){ FILE *fp=fopen("rand.txt","w"); /*è¦å†™å…¥çš„æ–‡ä»¶*/ FILE *fp2=NULL ; int i; int a[10000]; srand((unsigned int)time(NULL)); /*ä¸å¯æ”¾åœ¨å¾ªçŽ¯å†…ï¼Œå¦åˆ™æ¯æ¬¡å¾—åˆ°ç›¸åŒçš„â€œéšæœºæ•°â€*/ for (i = 0; i<10000; i++) { a[i]=rand(); fprintf(fp,"%d ",a[i]); } fclose(fp); qsort(a, 10000, sizeof(int), &cmp1);/*æŽ’åºå‡½æ•°ï¼Œè°ƒç”¨qsort()æ ‡å‡†åº“å‡½æ•°è¿›è¡ŒæŽ’åº*/ fp2=fopen("sort_rand.txt","w"); /*æŽ’åºä¹‹åŽè¦å†™å…¥çš„æ–‡ä»¶*/ for (i = 0; i<10000; i++) { fprintf(fp,"%d ",a[i]); } fclose(fp2); return 0;}int cmp1(const void * a,const void * b) { return (*(int*)a-*(int*)b);//a>b è¿”å›žæ­£å€¼} è¿›é˜¶ç»ƒä¹ 3.61234567891011121314151617181920212223242526272829303132#include <stdio.h>#include <stdlib.h>struct information { char a[15]; char b[10]; int c; double d; char e[10];};int main(void) { struct information inf[5]; int i; FILE *fp; for (i = 0; i < 5; i++) { scanf("%s%s%d%lf%s", inf[5].a, inf[5].b, &inf[5].c, &inf[5].d, inf[5].e); } fp = fopen("emloy.txt", "wb"); for (i = 0; i < 5; i++) { fwrite(&inf[i], sizeof(struct information), 1, fp); } fclose(fp); fp = fopen("emloy.txt", "rb"); for (i = 0; i < 5; i++) { fread(&inf[i], sizeof(struct information), 1, fp); printf("%s	%s	%d	%.2lf	%s
",inf[5].a,inf[5].b,inf[5].c,inf[5].d,inf[5].e); } fclose(fp); return 0;} 3.71234567891011121314151617181920212223242526#include <stdio.h>#include <stdlib.h>int main(void) { FILE *fp; char ch1,ch2; fp = fopen("test", "r"); if (fp == NULL) { printf("open file failed !

'); printf("%d
",min); return 0;} è¿›é˜¶ç»ƒä¹ 3.1(Unix)1234567891011121314151617181920212223242526272829303132333435363738394041424344454647484950515253545556575859606162#include <stdio.h>#include <termios.h>#include <unistd.h>#include <stdlib.h>#include <stdbool.h>#include <errno.h>#define ECHOFLAGS (ECHO | ECHOE | ECHOK | ECHONL)int set_disp_mode(int fd,int option){ int err; struct termios term; if(tcgetattr(fd,&term)==-1){ perror("Cannot get the attribution of the terminal"); return 1; } if(option) term.c_lflag|=ECHOFLAGS; else term.c_lflag &=~ECHOFLAGS; err=tcsetattr(fd,TCSAFLUSH,&term); if(err==-1 && err==EINTR){ perror("Cannot set the attribution of the terminal"); return 1; } return 0;}int getpasswd(char* passwd, int size){ int c; int n = 0; printf("Please Input password:"); do{ c=getchar(); if (c != '
'|c!=''){ passwd[n++] = c; } } while (c != '
' && c !='' && n < (size - 1)); passwd[n] = '\0'; return n;}int main(void){ char *p,passwd[20],corectPass[20] = {"nothingissafe"}; int n = 3; set_disp_mode(STDIN_FILENO,0); while (n--) { getpasswd(passwd, sizeof(passwd)); p=passwd; while(*p!='
') { p++; } *p='\0'; if (strcmp(passwd,corectPass) == 0) { printf("Welcome!
"); break; } printf("Wrong Password!
"); } set_disp_mode(STDIN_FILENO,1); return 0;} 3.21234567891011121314151617181920212223242526272829303132333435363738394041424344454647484950515253#include <stdio.h>#include <termios.h>#include <unistd.h>#include <stdlib.h>#include <time.h>#include <stdbool.h>#include <errno.h>int randNumber(void);int main(void) { srand((unsigned)time(NULL)); int a[10000],count = 0; FILE *fp1,*fp2 = NULL; if ((fp1 = fopen("data.txt", "w+")) == NULL) { printf("Can't open file:%s
", "data.txt"); exit(0); } for (int i = 0; i<10000; i++) { a[i] = randNumber(); fprintf(fp1,"%d ",a[i]); } fclose(fp1); for (int i = 0; i < 10000; i++) { int unitPlace = (a[i]/1)%10; int thousandPlace = (a[i]/1000)%10; if (unitPlace == thousandPlace) { count++; } if (a[i]%2 == 0) { a[i] = a[i]*10; } } fp2=fopen("data.txt","w+"); for (int i = 0; i < 10000; i++) { fprintf(fp1,"%d ",a[i]); } fclose(fp2); printf("The number of unitPlace equls to unitPlace:%d
",count); return 0;}int randNumber() { return rand()%9000 + 1000;} 3.5123456789101112131415161718192021222324252627282930313233343536373839404142434445464748495051525354555657585960616263646566676869707172737475767778798081828384858687888990919293949596979899100101102103104105106107108109110111112113114115116117118119120121122123124125126127128129#include <stdio.h>#include <termios.h>#include <unistd.h>#include <stdlib.h>#include <time.h>#include <stdbool.h>#include <errno.h>typedef struct TeleType{ char data[30]; struct TeleType *next;} NODE;NODE *createList(void);//1void prn(NODE *head);//2NODE *first_insert(NODE *head);//3NODE *reverse_copy(NODE *head);//4void free_link(NODE *head);//5void countstr(NODE* head);//6int main(void) { NODE *head = NULL; NODE *head1 = NULL; printf("put '0' to end
"); head = createList(); prn(head); first_insert(head); prn(head); reverse_copy(head); prn(head1); free_link(head); return 0;}NODE *createList(){ NODE *head = NULL,*p, *p1 = NULL; p = (NODE*)malloc(sizeof(NODE)); p->next = NULL; head = p; p1 = head; while(true){ p = (NODE*)malloc(sizeof(NODE)); scanf("%s", p->data); p->next = NULL; if(strcmp(p->data , "0") == 0){ free(p); break; } p1->next = p; p1 = p; } return head;}NODE *first_insert(NODE* head){ NODE *p1, *p2, *p; int index = 1,count = 0; p1 = head; p2 = p1->next; p = (NODE*)malloc(sizeof(NODE)); scanf("%s", p->data); p->next = NULL; while(p2 != NULL) { count++; if(count == index){ p -> next = p2; p1 -> next = p; break; } p1 = p2; p2 = p2->next; } return head;}NODE *reverse_copy(NODE *head1){ NODE *head = NULL,*p,*p2,*p1 = NULL; p = (NODE*)malloc(sizeof(NODE)); p->next = NULL; head = p; p1 = head; p2 = head1->next; while(p2 != NULL){ p = (NODE*)malloc(sizeof(NODE)); strcpy(p->data,p2->data); p = p ->next; } p->next = NULL; return head;}void free_link(NODE *head){ NODE *p, *p1; p = head; while(p != NULL){ p1 = p; p = p -> next; free(p1); }}void prn(NODE *head){ NODE *p; p = head->next; while(p != NULL){ printf("data is %s
", p->data); p = p->next; }}void countstr(NODE* head) { char a[30]; int count = 0; printf("
Put string which you wanna cheak:"); gets(a); NODE *p; p = head->next; while(p != NULL){ if (strcmp(a, p->data) == 0) { count++; } p = p->next; } printf("It shows %d times
",count);} ç»“æŸ

It allows you to launch & kill applications, tap & scroll views or confirm view presence on a screen. This makes it a perfect tool for application end-to-end testing or general purpose device automation. It works by linking XCTest.framework and calling Appleâ€™s API to execute commands directly on a device. ",a); return 0;} é—®é¢˜ C: FP2015-TEST1-EXPERIMENT5-2-5 ä¸‰ä¸ªæ•°æŽ’åºé¢˜ç›®æè¿°è¾“å…¥3ä¸ªæ•´æ•°ï¼Œè¦æ±‚æŒ‰ç”±å°åˆ°å¤§çš„é¡ºåºæŽ’åºï¼Œå¹¶è¾“å‡ºæŽ’åºåŽçš„ç»“æžœã€‚ è¾“å…¥è¾“å…¥çš„ç¬¬1è¡Œä¸ºä¸€ä¸ªæ•´æ•°nï¼Œè¡¨ç¤ºnç»„æµ‹è¯•æ•°æ®ï¼Œä¸‹é¢ä¸ºnè¡Œæµ‹è¯•æ•°æ®ã€‚æ¯ä¸€è¡Œæœ‰3ä¸ªæ•´æ•°ï¼Œåˆ†åˆ«ç”¨ä¸€ä¸ªç©ºæ ¼åˆ†å¼€ï¼Œä¾‹å¦‚ï¼š 21 2 3 4 3 2 è¾“å‡ºè¾“å‡ºä¸ºnè¡Œç»“æžœï¼Œæ¯ä¸€è¡Œ3ä¸ªæ•´æ•°ï¼Œä¸ºæŽ’å¥½åºçš„3ä¸ªæ•°ï¼Œä¸­é—´ç”¨ç©ºæ ¼åˆ†å¼€ã€‚è¾“å‡ºç»“æŸåŽï¼Œå…‰æ ‡åŽ»å¾€ä¸‹ä¸€è¡Œçš„è¡Œå¤´ã€‚ä¾‹å¦‚ï¼š 1 2 3 2 3 4 æ ·ä¾‹è¾“å…¥12321 2 34 3 2 æ ·ä¾‹è¾“å‡º121 2 32 3 4 å‚è€ƒç­”æ¡ˆ1234567891011121314151617181920212223242526272829#include <stdio.h>int main (void) { int n,a,b,c,temp; scanf("%d",&n); while(n--){ getchar(); scanf("%d%d%d",&a,&b,&c); if(a < b){ temp = a; a = b; b = temp; } if(a < c){ temp = a; a = c; c = temp; } if(b < c){ temp = b; b = c; c = temp; } printf("%d %d %d

C Primer Plusç¬¬å…­ç‰ˆ 417é¡µæœ‰è¿™æ ·ä¸€æ®µè¯ï¼šâ€œåƒUnixå’ŒLinuxè¿™æ ·åªæœ‰ä¸€ç§æ–‡ä»¶ç±»åž‹çš„ç³»ç»Ÿï¼Œå¸¦bå­—æ¯çš„æ¨¡å¼å’Œä¸å¸¦bå­—æ¯çš„æ¨¡å¼ç›¸åŒâ€ ä¸è®¨è®ºæœ€åº•å±‚ï¼Œå› ä¸ºæˆ‘å¤ªèœ å‘çŽ°é—®é¢˜æ€»æ‰€å‘¨çŸ¥ï¼Œfopen()çš„å‡½æ•°åŽŸåž‹æ˜¯ï¼šFILE *fopen(const char filename, const char mode) å…³äºŽchar *modeåœ¨ C primer Plus(ç¬¬å…­ç‰ˆ) è¿™æœ¬ä¹¦å¯¹åšå‡ºäº†ä»‹ç» æ¨¡å¼å­—ç¬¦ä¸² å«ä¹‰ â€œrâ€ ï¼ˆreadï¼‰ä»¥åªè¯»æ¨¡å¼æ‰“å¼€æ–‡ä»¶ â€œwâ€ ï¼ˆwriteï¼‰ä»¥å†™æ¨¡å¼æ‰“å¼€æ–‡ä»¶ï¼ŒæŠŠçŽ°æœ‰çš„æ–‡ä»¶é•¿åº¦æˆªæˆ0ï¼Œå¦‚æžœæ–‡ä»¶ä¸å­˜åœ¨ï¼Œåˆ™åˆ›å»ºå¯¹åº”çš„ä¸€ä¸ªæ–°æ–‡ä»¶ â€œaâ€ ï¼ˆappendï¼‰ä»¥å†™æ¨¡å¼æ‰“å¼€æ–‡ä»¶ï¼Œåœ¨çŽ°æœ‰æ–‡ä»¶æœ«å°¾æ·»åŠ å†…å®¹ï¼Œå¦‚æžœæ–‡ä»¶ä¸å­˜åœ¨ï¼Œåˆ™åˆ›å»ºå¯¹åº”çš„ä¸€ä¸ªæ–°æ–‡ä»¶ â€œr+â€ ä»¥æ›´æ–°æ¨¡å¼æ‰“å¼€æ–‡ä»¶ï¼ˆå³å¯ä»¥è¯»å†™æ–‡ä»¶ï¼‰ â€œw+â€ ä»¥æ›´æ–°æ¨¡å¼æ‰“å¼€æ–‡ä»¶ï¼ˆå³è¯»å’Œå†™ï¼‰ï¼Œå¦‚æžœæ–‡ä»¶å­˜åœ¨ï¼Œåˆ™å°†å…¶é•¿åº¦æˆªæˆ0ï¼›å¦‚æžœæ–‡ä»¶ä¸å­˜åœ¨ï¼Œåˆ™åˆ›å»ºä¸€ä¸ªæ–°æ–‡ä»¶ â€œa+â€ ä»¥æ›´æ–°æ¨¡å¼æ‰“å¼€æ–‡ä»¶ï¼ˆå³è¯»å’Œå†™ï¼‰ï¼Œåœ¨çŽ°æœ‰æ–‡ä»¶æœ«å°¾æ·»åŠ å†…å®¹ï¼Œå¦‚æžœæ–‡ä»¶ä¸å­˜åœ¨ï¼Œåˆ™åˆ›å»ºä¸€ä¸ªæ–°æ–‡ä»¶ï¼›å¯ä»¥è¯»æ•´ä¸ªæ–‡ä»¶ï¼Œä½†æ˜¯åªèƒ½ä»Žæœ«å°¾æ·»åŠ å†…å®¹ â€œrbâ€ã€â€wbâ€ã€â€abâ€ã€â€rb+â€ã€â€r+bâ€ã€ â€œwb+â€ã€â€w+bâ€ã€â€ab+â€ã€â€a+bâ€ ä¸Žä¸Šä¸€ä¸ªæ¨¡å¼ç±»ä¼¼ï¼Œä½†æ˜¯æ˜¯ä»¥äºŒè¿›åˆ¶æ¨¡å¼è€Œä¸æ˜¯æ–‡æœ¬æ¨¡å¼æ‰“å¼€æ–‡ä»¶ â€œwxâ€ã€â€wbxâ€ã€â€w+xâ€ã€â€wb+xâ€æˆ–â€w+bxâ€ ï¼ˆc11ï¼‰ç±»ä¼¼éžxæ¨¡å¼ï¼Œä½†æ˜¯å¦‚æžœæ–‡ä»¶å·²å­˜åœ¨æˆ–ä»¥ç‹¬å æ¨¡å¼æ‰“å¼€æ–‡ä»¶ï¼Œåˆ™æ‰“å¼€æ–‡ä»¶å¤±è´¥ ä½†ä¸‹æ–¹æœ‰ä¸€æ®µè¯ï¼š â€œåƒUnixå’ŒLinuxè¿™æ ·åªæœ‰ä¸€ç§æ–‡ä»¶ç±»åž‹çš„ç³»ç»Ÿï¼Œå¸¦bå­—æ¯çš„æ¨¡å¼å’Œä¸å¸¦bå­—æ¯çš„æ¨¡å¼ç›¸åŒâ€ é‚£ä¹ˆï¼Œè¯‘è€…çš„æ„æ€æ˜¯ï¼ŒWindowsä¸åªæœ‰ä¸€ç§æ–‡ä»¶ç±»åž‹çš„ç³»ç»Ÿï¼Œè€ŒLinuxåªæœ‰ä¸€ç§ï¼Ÿé‚£æ˜¯ä»€ä¹ˆå·®å¼‚å¯¼è‡´çš„å‘¢ï¼Ÿ æŽ¢ç´¢ä¸Šæœºé¦–å…ˆè‡ªç„¶æ˜¯åœ¨ä¸åŒçŽ¯å¢ƒä¸‹æµ‹è¯•å•¦ æµ‹è¯•ä»£ç 123456789#include <stdio.h>int main(void){ FILE *fp = NULL; fp = fopen("test.txt", "wb+");//ä½¿ç”¨äºŒè¿›åˆ¶æ ¼å¼ä¿å­˜ fprintf(fp, "This is testing for fprintf...
"); fputs("This is testing for fputs...
", fp); fclose(fp); return 0;} æµ‹è¯•çŽ¯å¢ƒwindows 10 -1709 -VC6++ å¯ä»¥å‘çŽ°æ–‡æœ¬æ¨¡å¼å¹¶ä¸èƒ½æ­£ç¡®è¯†åˆ« Kail Linux -2017.3-GCC 7.2 Linuxå¯ä»¥è¯†åˆ« macOS -High Sierra-Xcode 9.3 entry.content: å¼•å­ï¼šC è¯­è¨€ä¸­int main()å’Œ void main() æœ‰ä½•åŒºåˆ«ï¼Ÿ å‰è¨€ æ–‡ç« åŸºäºŽå®˜æ–¹æ–‡æ¡£æ±‡æ€»è€Œæˆï¼Œå¼•ç”¨åœ°å€ä¼šæ”¾åœ¨æ–‡ç« æœ«å°¾ï¼Œè‹¥æœ‰ä¿®æ”¹æ„è§æ¬¢è¿Žè¯„è®ºæŒ‡å‡ºï½ž åˆšå¼€å§‹ä¸Šè¯¾çš„æ—¶å€™ï¼Œéš¾å…ä¼šæŽ¥è§¦åˆ°int main()å’Œvoid main()ï¼Œå½“åˆæˆ‘åªæ˜¯åˆæ­¥è®¤è¯†åˆ°äº†void main()æ˜¯ä¸€ç§ ä¸æ ‡å‡† çš„å†™æ³•ï¼Œä½†æ˜¯ä»Šå¤©è¿›ä¸€æ­¥è®¤è¯†åˆ°void main()ç®—æ˜¯ä¸€ç§Undefined behavior(æœªå®šä¹‰è¡Œä¸º)ã€‚ mainå‡½æ•°åŽŸåž‹&&ç»ˆæ­¢è¡Œä¸ºåœ¨Cå’ŒC++ä¸­æµä¼ ç€å¾ˆå¤šç‰ˆæœ¬çš„mainå‡½æ•°åŽŸåž‹ï¼Œä¸åŒçš„ä¹¦é‡Œä¹Ÿæœ‰ä¸åŒçš„å†™æ³•ã€‚ä»Šå¤©æˆ‘ä»Žå‡ ç§æ ‡å‡†(C89/99/11ä»¥åŠC++98/03/11/14)çš„è§’åº¦æ¥å¯»æ‰¾ä¸€ä¸‹ä»€ä¹ˆæ˜¯â€œæ ‡å‡†è¡Œä¸ºâ€ä»¥åŠåœ¨ä¸»å‡½æ•°ä¸­returnåŽå‘ç”Ÿäº†ä»€ä¹ˆã€‚ æ¯”è¾ƒå¸¸è§çš„æ˜¯ä¸‹é¢å‡ ç§ï¼š 12345void main()main()int main()int main(void)int main(int argc,char *argv[]) void main()é¦–å…ˆï¼Œä»Žæ ‡å‡†è§’åº¦(æ‰€æœ‰ç‰ˆæœ¬)æ¥è¯´ï¼Œvoid main()è‚¯å®šæ˜¯é”™çš„ï¼Œæ²¡æœ‰ä»»ä½•æ ‡å‡†(C89/99/11ä»¥åŠC++98/03/11/14)ä¸­å…è®¸è¿‡è¿™ç§å†™æ³•ã€‚ ä½†æ˜¯æˆ‘åœ¨APUEé‡Œçœ‹åˆ°äº†ä¸€ç§æŠŠä¸»å‡½æ•°å†™ä¸ºvoid main()çš„åŽŸå› ï¼Œä¸çŸ¥é“æ˜¯ä¸æ˜¯æœ‰äººä»Žè¿™ä¸ªè§’åº¦è¯´çš„ç„¶åŽå°±ä»¥è®¹ä¼ è®¹äº†ã€‚ The problem is that these compilers donâ€™t know that an exit from main is the same as a return. One way around these warnings, which become annoying after a while, is to use return instead of exit from main. But doing this prevents us from using the UNIX Systemâ€™s grep utility to locate all calls to exit from a program. Another solution is to declare main as returning void, instead of int, and continue calling exit. C99/11 Standardåœ¨C99/11æ ‡å‡†ä¸­ï¼Œæ˜Žç¡®å®šä¹‰äº†å¯¹äºŽæ ‡å‡†çš„mainå‡½æ•°çš„ä¸¤ä¸ªåŽŸåž‹ï¼š æ‘˜è‡ªISO/IEC 9899:201x ä¸­5.1.2.2.1åœ¨çº¿æŸ¥é˜…&&ä¸‹è½½ The function called at program startup is named main. The implementation declares no prototype for this function. It shall be defined with a return type of int and with no parameters: 1int main(void) { /* ... */ } or with two parameters (referred to here as argc and argv, though any names may be used, as they are local to the function in which they are declared): 1int main(int argc, char *argv[]) { /* ... */ } or equivalent;or in some other implementation-defined manner.If they are declared, the parameters to the main function shall obey the following constraints: The value of argc shall be nonnegative. argv[argc] shall be a null pointer. If the value of argc is greater than zero, the array members argv[0] through argv[argc-1] inclusive shall contain pointers to strings, which are given implementation-defined values by the host environment prior to program startup. The intent is to supply to the program information determined prior to program startup from elsewhere in the hosted environment. If the host environment is not capable of supplying strings with letters in both uppercase and lowercase, the implementation shall ensure that the strings are received in lowercase. If the value of argc is greater than zero, the string pointed to by argv[0]represents the program name; argv[0][0] shall be the null character if the program name is not available from the host environment. If the value of argc is greater than one, the strings pointed to by argv[1] through argv[argc-1]represent the program parameters. The parameters argc and argv and the strings pointed to by the argv array shall be modifiable by the program, and retain their last-stored values between program startup and program termination. If control reaches the end of main without encountering a return statement, the eï¬€ect is that of executing 1return 0; å¾…è¡¥å…… exit12#include <stdlib.h>void exit(int status); The exit function causes normal program termination to occur. If more than one call to the exit function is executed by a program, the behavior is undefined. First, all functions registered by the atexit function are called, in the reverse order of their registration,except that a function is called after any previously registered functions that had already been called at the time it was registered. If, during the call to any such function, a call to the longjmp function is made that would terminate the call to the registered function, the behavior is undefined. Next, all open streams with unwritten buffered data are ï¬‚ushed, all open streams are closed, and all files created by the tmpfile function are removed. Finally, control is returned to the host environment. If the value of status is zero or EXIT_SUCCESS, an implementation-defined form of the status successful termination is returned. If the value of status is EXIT_FAILURE, an implementation-defined form of the status unsuccessful termination is returned. Otherwise the status returned is implementation-defined. The exit function cannot return to its caller. _Exit12#include <stdlib.h>void _Exit(int status); The _Exit function causes normal program termination to occur and control to be returned to the host environment. No functions registered by the atexit function or signal handlers registered by the signal function are called. The status returned to the host environment is determined in the same way as for the exit function (7.20.4.3).Whether open streams with unwritten buffered data are ï¬‚ushed, open streams are closed,or temporary files are removed is implementation-defined.The _Exit function cannot return to its caller. The following example will however cause undefined behavior in both C++ and C. åœ¨ä¸¤ä¸ªè¿žç»­ç‚¹ä¹‹é—´å¤šæ¬¡ä¿®æ”¹å¯¹è±¡ä¼šäº§ç”Ÿæœªå®šä¹‰çš„è¡Œä¸ºã€‚å€¼å¾—ä¸€æçš„æ˜¯ï¼Œä¸ŽC ++ 11ç›¸æ¯”ï¼Œæœªå®šä¹‰çš„è¡Œä¸ºä¸Žé¡ºåºç‚¹çš„å…³ç³»æœ‰æ‰€æ”¹å˜ã€‚ä¸‹é¢çš„ä¾‹å­ç„¶è€Œä¼šå¯¼è‡´C ++å’ŒC ä¸­æœªå®šä¹‰çš„è¡Œä¸º 1i = i++ + 1; // undefined behavior When modifying an object between two sequence points, reading the value of the object for any other purpose than determining the value to be stored is also undefined behavior. åœ¨ä¸¤ä¸ªè¿žç»­ç‚¹ä¹‹é—´ä¿®æ”¹å¯¹è±¡æ—¶ï¼Œé™¤äº†ç¡®å®šè¦å­˜å‚¨çš„å€¼ä¹‹å¤–ï¼Œè¯»å–å¯¹è±¡çš„å€¼ä¹Ÿæ˜¯æœªå®šä¹‰çš„è¡Œä¸ºã€‚ 12a[i] = i++; // undefined behaviorprintf("%d %d\n", ++n, power(2, n)); // also undefined behavior BenefitsDocumenting an operation as undefined behavior allows compilers to assume that this operation will never happen in a conforming program. This gives the compiler more information about the code and this information can lead to more optimization opportunities. å°†è®°å½•ä¸ºæœªå®šä¹‰çš„è¡Œä¸ºå…è®¸ç¼–è¯‘å™¨å‡å®šè¿™ä¸ªè¡Œä¸ºæ°¸è¿œä¸ä¼šåœ¨ç¬¦åˆçš„ç¨‹åºä¸­æ‰§è¡Œã€‚è¿™ç»™äº†ç¼–è¯‘å™¨æ›´å¤šå…³äºŽä»£ç çš„ä¿¡æ¯ï¼Œè¿™äº›ä¿¡æ¯å¯ä»¥æœ‰æ›´å¤šæœºä¼šåŽ»ä¼˜åŒ–ä»£ç ã€‚ Cè¯­è¨€çš„ä¸€ä¸ªä¾‹å­ï¼š An example for the C language: 1234567int foo(unsigned char x){ int value = 2147483600; /* assuming 32 bit int */ value += x; if (value < 2147483600) bar(); return value;} The value of x cannot be negative and, given that signed integer overflow is undefined behavior in C, the compiler can assume that at the line of the if check value >= 2147483600. Thus the if and the call to the function bar can be ignored by the compiler since the if has no side effects and its condition will never be satisfied. The code above is therefore semantically equivalent to: xä¸èƒ½ä¸ºè´Ÿå€¼ï¼Œå¹¶ä¸”è€ƒè™‘åˆ°æœ‰ç¬¦å·æ•´æ•°æº¢å‡ºåœ¨Cä¸­æ˜¯æœªå®šä¹‰çš„è¡Œä¸ºï¼Œç¼–è¯‘å™¨å¯ä»¥å‡è®¾åœ¨ifæ£€æŸ¥value >= 2147483600ã€‚å› æ­¤ifå¯¹å‡½æ•°çš„è°ƒç”¨barå¯ä»¥è¢«ç¼–è¯‘å™¨å¿½ç•¥ï¼Œå› ä¸ºifæ²¡æœ‰å¸¦æ¥ä»»ä½•å½±å“ï¼Œå®ƒçš„æ¡ä»¶æ°¸è¿œä¸ä¼šè¢«æ»¡è¶³ã€‚ä¸Šé¢çš„ä»£ç å› æ­¤åœ¨è¯­ä¹‰ä¸Šç­‰åŒäºŽï¼š 12345int foo(unsigned char x){ int value = 2147483600; value += x; return value;} Had the compiler been forced to assume that signed integer overflow has wraparound behavior, then the transformation above would not have been legal. Such optimizations become hard to spot by humans when the code is more complex and other optimizations, like inlining, take place. Another benefit from allowing signed integer overflow to be undefined is that it makes it possible to store and manipulate a variableâ€™s value in a processor register that is larger than the size of the variable in the source code. For example, if the type of a variable as specified in the source code is narrower than the native register width (such as â€œint on a 64-bit machine, a common scenario), then the compiler can safely use a signed 64-bit integer for the variable in the machine code it produces, without changing the defined behavior of the code. If the behavior of a 32-bit integer under overflow conditions was depended upon by the program, then a compiler would have to insert additional logic when compiling for a 64-bit machine, because the overflow behavior of most machine code instructions depends on the register width. A further important benefit of undefined signed integer overflow is that it enables, though does not require, such erroneous overflows to be detected at compile-time or by static program analysis, or by run-time checks such as the Clang and GCC sanitizers and valgrind; if such overflow was defined with a valid semantics such as wrap-around then compile-time checks would not be possible. å¦‚æžœç¼–è¯‘å™¨è¢«è¿«å‡å®šæœ‰ç¬¦å·æ•´æ•°æº¢å‡ºå…·æœ‰çŽ¯ç»•è¡Œä¸ºï¼Œé‚£ä¹ˆä¸Šé¢çš„è½¬æ¢å°±ä¸åˆæ³•äº†ã€‚ å½“ä»£ç æ›´å¤æ‚æ—¶ï¼Œäººä»¬éš¾ä»¥å‘çŽ°è¿™æ ·çš„ä¼˜åŒ–ï¼Œå¹¶ä½œå‡ºå…¶ä»–ä¼˜åŒ–ï¼Œå¦‚å†…è”ã€‚ å…è®¸æœ‰ç¬¦å·æ•´æ•°æº¢å‡ºæœªå®šä¹‰çš„å¦ä¸€ä¸ªå¥½å¤„æ˜¯å¯ä»¥åœ¨å¤„ç†å™¨å¯„å­˜å™¨ä¸­å­˜å‚¨å’Œæ“ä½œå˜é‡çš„å€¼ï¼Œè¯¥å¯„å­˜å™¨çš„å€¼å¤§äºŽæºä»£ç ä¸­å˜é‡çš„å¤§å°ã€‚ä¾‹å¦‚ï¼Œå¦‚æžœæºä»£ç ä¸­æŒ‡å®šçš„å˜é‡ç±»åž‹æ¯”æœ¬åœ°å¯„å­˜å™¨å®½åº¦çª„ï¼ˆä¾‹å¦‚64ä½æœºå™¨ä¸Šçš„â€œ int â€ ï¼Œè¿™æ˜¯æœ€å¸¸è§çš„æƒ…å†µï¼‰ï¼Œé‚£ä¹ˆç¼–è¯‘å™¨å¯ä»¥å®‰å…¨åœ°ä½¿ç”¨å¸¦ç¬¦å·çš„ 64 ä½å¯„å­˜å™¨ æœºå™¨ä»£ç ä¸­äº§ç”Ÿçš„æ•´æ•°å˜é‡ï¼Œè€Œä¸ä¼šæ”¹å˜ä»£ç çš„å®šä¹‰è¡Œä¸ºã€‚å¦‚æžœåœ¨æº¢å‡ºæ¡ä»¶ä¸‹32ä½æ•´æ•°çš„è¡Œä¸ºè¢«ç¨‹åºæ‰€ä¾èµ–ï¼Œé‚£ä¹ˆåœ¨ç¼–è¯‘64ä½æœºå™¨æ—¶ï¼Œç¼–è¯‘å™¨å°†ä¸å¾—ä¸è€ƒè™‘é¢å¤–çš„é€»è¾‘ï¼Œå› ä¸ºå¤§å¤šæ•°æœºå™¨ä»£ç æŒ‡ä»¤çš„æº¢å‡ºè¡Œä¸ºå–å†³äºŽå¯„å­˜å™¨å®½åº¦. æœªå®šä¹‰çš„æœ‰ç¬¦å·æ•´æ•°æº¢å‡ºçš„å¦ä¸€ä¸ªé‡è¦å¥½å¤„æ˜¯ï¼Œå®ƒå¯ä»¥åœ¨ç¼–è¯‘æ—¶æˆ–é€šè¿‡é™æ€ç¨‹åºåˆ†æžæˆ–é€šè¿‡è¿è¡Œæ—¶æ£€æŸ¥ï¼ˆå¦‚Clangå’ŒGCC sanitizerså’Œvalgrindæ¥æ£€æµ‹è¿™ç§æº¢å‡ºçš„é”™è¯¯; å¦‚æžœè¿™æ ·çš„æº¢å‡ºæ˜¯ç”¨ä¸€ä¸ªæœ‰æ•ˆçš„è¯­ä¹‰æ¥å®šä¹‰çš„ï¼Œæ¯”å¦‚çŽ¯ç»•è¡Œä¸ºï¼Œé‚£ä¹ˆç¼–è¯‘æ—¶æ£€æŸ¥æ˜¯ä¸å¯èƒ½çš„ã€‚ RisksC and C++ standards have several forms of undefined behavior throughout, which offers increased liberty in compiler implementations and compile-time checks at the expense of undefined run-time behavior if present. In particular, there is an appendix section dedicated to a non-exhaustive listing of common sources of undefined behavior in C. Moreoever, compilers are not required to diagnose code that relies on undefined behavior, due to current static analysis limitations. Hence, it is common for programmers, even experienced ones, to unintentionally rely on undefined behavior either by mistake, or simply because they are not well-versed in the rules of the language that can span over hundreds of pages. This can result in bugs that are exposed when optimizations are enabled on the compiler, or when a compiler of a different vendor or version is used. Testing or fuzzing with dynamic undefined behavior checks enabled, e.g. the Clang sanitizers, can help to catch undefined behavior not diagnosed by the compiler or static analyzers. In scenarios where security is critical, undefined behavior can lead to security vulnerabilities in software. When GCCâ€™s developers changed their compiler in 2008 such that it omitted certain overflow checks that relied on undefined behavior, CERT issued a warning against the newer versions of the compiler. Linux Weekly News pointed out that the same behavior was observed in PathScale C, Microsoft Visual C++ 2005 and several other compilers; the warning was later amended to warn about various compilers. ",a);//è¾“å‡ºç”¨æˆ·è¾“å…¥çš„æ•°æ® free(a);//é‡Šæ”¾æŽ‰ä½¿ç”¨çš„å†…å­˜åœ°å€ return 0;//ä¾‹2æœ‰æ— å†…å­˜æ³„éœ²ï¼Ÿ}æ³¨ï¼šä¾‹1ï¼šå¯¹mallocç”³è¯·ä¹‹åŽæ²¡æœ‰æ£€æµ‹è¿”å›žå€¼ï¼›ä¾‹2ï¼šæ£€æµ‹mallocè¿”å›žå€¼æ¡ä»¶æœ‰è¯¯ï¼ˆä¾‹2æ˜¯å¯¹çš„ä¹ˆï¼Ÿï¼‰ã€‚ ç‰¹åˆ«æ³¨æ„ï¼ï¼ï¼ï¼šå‡½æ•°çš„å®žå‚ä¸º sizeof(int) ï¼Œç”¨äºŽæŒ‡æ˜Žä¸€ä¸ªæ•´åž‹æ•°æ®éœ€è¦çš„å¤§å°ã€‚å¦‚æžœä½ å†™æˆ: int p = (int ) malloc (1); ä»£ç ä¹Ÿèƒ½é€šè¿‡ç¼–è¯‘ï¼Œä½†äº‹å®žä¸Šåªåˆ†é…äº†1ä¸ªå­—èŠ‚å¤§å°çš„å†…å­˜ç©ºé—´ï¼Œå½“ä½ å¾€é‡Œå¤´å­˜å…¥ä¸€ä¸ªæ•´æ•°ï¼Œå°±ä¼šæœ‰3ä¸ªå­—èŠ‚æ²¡ç©ºé—´å­˜æ”¾ï¼Œè€Œå äº†å…¶ä»–çš„ä½ç½®ï¼é€ æˆçš„ç»“æžœæ˜¯åŽé¢çš„å†…å­˜ä¸­åŽŸæœ‰æ•°æ®å†…å®¹è¢«æ”¹å†™ã€‚ 2>realloc:å‡½æ•°åŽŸåž‹ä¸ºï¼šextern void realloc(void mem_address, unsigned int newsize); åŠŸèƒ½ï¼šå…ˆåˆ¤æ–­å½“å‰çš„æŒ‡é’ˆæ˜¯å¦æœ‰è¶³å¤Ÿçš„è¿žç»­ç©ºé—´ï¼Œå¦‚æžœæœ‰ï¼Œæ‰©å¤§mem_addressæŒ‡å‘çš„åœ°å€ï¼Œå¹¶ä¸”å°†mem_addressè¿”å›žï¼Œå¦‚æžœç©ºé—´ä¸å¤Ÿï¼Œå…ˆæŒ‰ç…§newsizeæŒ‡å®šçš„å¤§å°åˆ†é…ç©ºé—´ï¼Œå°†åŽŸæœ‰æ•°æ®ä»Žå¤´åˆ°å°¾æ‹·è´åˆ°æ–°åˆ†é…çš„å†…å­˜åŒºåŸŸï¼Œè€ŒåŽé‡Šæ”¾åŽŸæ¥mem_addressæ‰€æŒ‡å†…å­˜åŒºåŸŸï¼ŒåŒæ—¶è¿”å›žæ–°åˆ†é…çš„å†…å­˜åŒºåŸŸçš„é¦–åœ°å€ã€‚å³é‡æ–°åˆ†é…å­˜å‚¨å™¨å—çš„åœ°å€ã€‚æ–°çš„å¤§å°ä¸€å®šè¦å¤§äºŽåŽŸæ¥çš„å¤§å°ä¸ç„¶çš„è¯ä¼šå¯¼è‡´æ•°æ®ä¸¢å¤±ï¼ è¿”å›žå€¼ï¼šå¦‚æžœé‡æ–°åˆ†é…æˆåŠŸåˆ™è¿”å›žæŒ‡å‘è¢«åˆ†é…å†…å­˜çš„æŒ‡é’ˆï¼Œå¦åˆ™è¿”å›žç©ºæŒ‡é’ˆNULLã€‚ è¯­æ³•ï¼šæŒ‡é’ˆå=ï¼ˆæ•°æ®ç±»åž‹*ï¼‰reallocï¼ˆè¦æ”¹å˜å†…å­˜å¤§å°çš„æŒ‡é’ˆåï¼Œæ–°çš„å¤§å°ï¼‰ ç”¨æ³•ï¼š 12char *p = (char *)malloc(sizeof(char));p= (char *)realloc(p, 256);//å°†pæ‰€æŒ‡å‘çš„å¯¹è±¡çš„å¤§å°æ”¹ä¸ºsizeä¸ªå­—èŠ‚. å®žä¾‹ ä¾‹1 123456789101112131415161718#include<stdio.h>#include<stdlib.h>int main(){ inti; int*pn=(int*)malloc(5*sizeof(int)); printf("malloc%p
",pn); for(i=0;i<5;i++) pn[i]=i; pn=(int*)realloc(pn,10*sizeof(int)); printf("realloc%p
",pn); for(i=5;i<10;i++) pn[i]=i; for(i=0;i<10;i++) printf("%3d",pn[i]); free(pn); return 0;} ä¾‹2 12345678910111213141516171819202122//realloc.c#include<syslib.h>#include<alloc.h>main(){ char*p; clrscr();//clearscreen p=(char*)malloc(100); if(p) printf("Memory Allocatedat:%x",p); else printf("Not Enough Memory!
"); getchar(); p=(char*)realloc(p,256); if(p) printf("Memory Reallocatedat:%x",p); else printf("Not Enough Memory!
"); free(p); getchar(); return 0;} 3>calloc:å‡½æ•°åŽŸåž‹ä¸ºï¼švoid *calloc(unsigned n,unsigned size)ï¼› åŠŸèƒ½ï¼šåœ¨å†…å­˜çš„åŠ¨æ€å­˜å‚¨åŒºä¸­åˆ†é…nä¸ªé•¿åº¦ä¸ºsizeçš„è¿žç»­ç©ºé—´ï¼Œå‡½æ•°è¿”å›žä¸€ä¸ªæŒ‡å‘åˆ†é…èµ·å§‹åœ°å€çš„æŒ‡é’ˆï¼›å¦‚æžœåˆ†é…ä¸æˆåŠŸï¼Œè¿”å›žNULLã€‚ è¿”å›žå€¼ï¼šå¦‚æžœåˆ†é…æˆåŠŸåˆ™è¿”å›žæŒ‡å‘è¢«åˆ†é…å†…å­˜çš„æŒ‡é’ˆ(æ­¤å­˜å‚¨åŒºä¸­çš„åˆå§‹å€¼ä¸ºé›¶)ï¼Œå¦åˆ™è¿”å›žç©ºæŒ‡é’ˆNULLã€‚å½“å†…å­˜ä¸å†ä½¿ç”¨æ—¶ï¼Œåº”ä½¿ç”¨free()å‡½æ•°å°†å†…å­˜å—é‡Šæ”¾ã€‚å‡½æ•°è¿”å›žçš„æŒ‡é’ˆä¸€å®šè¦é€‚å½“å¯¹é½ï¼Œä½¿å…¶å¯ä»¥ç”¨äºŽä»»ä½•æ•°æ®å¯¹è±¡ã€‚ ä¸Žmallocçš„åŒºåˆ«ï¼šcallocåœ¨åŠ¨æ€åˆ†é…å®Œå†…å­˜åŽï¼Œè‡ªåŠ¨åˆå§‹åŒ–è¯¥å†…å­˜ç©ºé—´ä¸ºé›¶ï¼Œè€Œmallocä¸åˆå§‹åŒ–ï¼Œé‡Œè¾¹æ•°æ®æ˜¯éšæœºçš„åžƒåœ¾æ•°æ®ã€‚ ç”¨æ³•ï¼š void *malloc(size_t size); 1str = (char*)calloc(10,sizeof(char)) å®žä¾‹ ä¾‹1 123456789101112#include<stdio.h>#include<stdlib.h>#include<string.h>int main(){ char*str = NULL; str = (char*)calloc(10,sizeof(char));/*åˆ†é…å†…å­˜ç©ºé—´*/ strcpy(str, "Hello");/*å°†helloå†™å…¥*/ printf("String is %s
",str);/*æ˜¾ç¤ºå˜é‡å†…å®¹*/ free(str);/*é‡Šæ”¾ç©ºé—´*/ return 0;} ä¾‹2 123456789101112#include<stdio.h>#include<stdlib.h>int main(){ int i; int* pn = (int*)calloc(10, sizeof(int)); for(i = 0;i < 10;i++) printf("%d", pn[i]); printf("
"); free(pn); return 0;} 4>_alloca:å‡½æ•°åŽŸåž‹ä¸ºï¼švoid * __cdecl alloca(size_t); ä»‹ç»ï¼šå†…å­˜åˆ†é…å‡½æ•°,ä¸Žmalloc,calloc,reallocç±»ä¼¼. ä½†æ˜¯æ³¨æ„ä¸€ä¸ªé‡è¦çš„åŒºåˆ«,_allocaæ˜¯åœ¨æ ˆ(stack)ä¸Šç”³è¯·ç©ºé—´,ç”¨å®Œé©¬ä¸Šå°±é‡Šæ”¾. åŒ…å«åœ¨å¤´æ–‡ä»¶malloc.hä¸­. åœ¨æŸäº›ç³»ç»Ÿä¸­ä¼šå®å®šä¹‰æˆallocaä½¿ç”¨. #define alloca _alloca æ³¨æ„ åœ¨è°ƒç”¨ _allocaçš„å‡½æ•°è¿”å›žçš„æ—¶å€™, å®ƒåˆ†é…çš„å†…å­˜ä¼šè‡ªåŠ¨é‡Šæ”¾ã€‚ ä¹Ÿå°±æ˜¯è¯´, ç”¨ alloca åˆ†é…çš„å†…å­˜åœ¨æ ˆä¸Šã€‚ _alloca ä¸å…·å¯ç§»æ¤æ€§, è€Œä¸”åœ¨æ²¡æœ‰ä¼ ç»Ÿå †æ ˆçš„æœºå™¨ä¸Šå¾ˆéš¾å®žçŽ°ã€‚ å½“å®ƒçš„è¿”å›žå€¼ç›´æŽ¥ä¼ å…¥å¦ä¸€ä¸ªå‡½æ•°æ—¶ä¼šå¸¦æ¥é—®é¢˜,å› ä¸ºä»–åˆ†é…åœ¨æ ˆä¸Š. ç”±äºŽè¿™äº›åŽŸå› , _alloca ä¸å®œä½¿ç”¨åœ¨å¿…é¡»å¹¿æ³›ç§»æ¤çš„ç¨‹åºä¸­, ä¸ç®¡å®ƒå¯èƒ½å¤šä¹ˆæœ‰ç”¨ã€‚ æ—¢ç„¶ C99 æ”¯æŒå˜é•¿æ•°ç»„, å®ƒå¯ä»¥ç”¨æ¥æ›´å¥½çš„ å®Œæˆ alloca() ä»¥å‰çš„ä»»åŠ¡ã€‚
